title: Business Live: Pound higher - BBC News

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's all for tonight from business live - thanks for reading .
do join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: timing is everything
text: political editor laura kuenssberg tweets :
time for her to face the nutters down and finally put country before her personal survival .
yeah , fuck democracy .
thanks for you 're opinion , but i bet you forecast the four horsemen of the apocalypse for merely for voting brexit so yeah , fuck democracy .
no - just read your own shitty govts forecasts .
btw may went to the country seeking a mandate for this type of brexit .
she lost her majority .
so fuck selective democracy
brahahaha , economic forecasters could n't even tell you what happened yesterday never mind in 15 years time , they exist solely to make astrologers look good .
as for the mandate , if exit brexits a thing then how come the lib dems where as popular as used andrex at the election ?
wtf you waffling on about with your daft analogies and memes ?
go and bore someone else .
to much for you was it ?
all your points , trashed so reverts to well i 'm not sure what .
tell you something for nothing , you 're a keeper .
i 'm following you and you 're hilarity # goodtimes
the brexiteers are a small minority ( just 62 signed the letter ) driven by a let 's pretend '' world view .
it 's time for the majority who favour a sensible brexit to stand up to them .
history will not be kind if they do n't .

@ twitterid they are asking for things that under the current negotiations can not be achieved , they 're asking her to start negotiations with other countries when it 's not possible , they 're basically threatening her with become more hardline brexit or find a new job ''
the uk is able to negotiate trade deals at any time , and is currently doing so , it just ca n't implement them whilst members of the eu .
fair enough , but if you do n't know the outcome yet of brexit re standards , conformity of products are you going to trade exclusively outside the eu27 ?
if you 're not going to adhere to the same standards that are set by eu27 you ca n't wo n't trade with them
the trade deals being discussed are with third-parties ( non-eu ) .
no one is suggesting a lowering of standards regulatory alignment will certainly be a thing .
calling bbc calling this is bbc calling # impartial
she should call their bluff , call an election , most will lose their seats and restart with a hung parliament .

personally , think that erg letter would have been more impressive were it to have had the signatures written in pen and ink , rather like the gunpowder plot one below .
after brexit is stopped , those signatories will be seen as rascals trying to destroy the uk .
# stopbrexit

documents.title: wall street ends lower
text: a big slide in walmart dragged wall street lower after the world 's biggest retailer reported a lower-than-expected profit and asharp drop in online sales growth in the christmas period .
its shares slumped more than 10 % in new york .
the dow jones industrial average fell 1 % , the s & p 500 lost 0.6 % , and the nasdaq composite was almost flat .

documents.title: fox extends sky news guarantee
text: rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox has extended extended a commitment to maintain a sky-branded news service from at least five years to at least 10 as part of fox 's bid to take full control of the satellite broadcaster .
the murdoch-owned group tabled a series of measures in an attempt to guarantee the editorial independence of sky news earlier this month .
it followed concerns from the competition watchdog that a tie-up would give mr murdoch too much control over uk media .

documents.title: bitcoin bounce
text: while venezuela is busy trying to generate some cash with its new oil-based cryptocurrency , our old favourite - bitcoin - has been quietly regaining some ground , as recode notes :
bitcoin prices are back up 30 percent over the last week
there are fluctuations but steady rise in price

documents.title: at & t 'falls short '
text: us district judge richard leon has denied at & t 's request for white house communications about its takeover of time warner .
at & t had requested the records as part of its fight with the justice department , which sued to block the takeover last year , citing competition concerns .
mr leon said at & t fell `` far short '' of making a compelling case that the lawsuit suggested it was being singled out for selective enforcement .
`` history belies the notion that this action is the first and only time that the government has found an antitrust problem with a proposed vertical merger , '' he wrote .
at & t has suggested that politics could play a role in the lawsuit , due to president donald trump 's friction with cnn , the news channel owned by time warner .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: could gatwick build heathrow ?
text: it was an idea that was raised in this afternoon 's transport select committee hearing .
part of the issue around proposed heathrow expansion is the cost .
would greater competition in bidding stage reduce the estimated cost of the project ?
gatwick management has the expertise to build terminals and expand the associated services .
why not encourage them to bid for building the new development at heathrow ?
willie walsh welcomed the idea .
all ( iag , easyjet , virgin atlantic ) confirmed that the dft/secretary of state had not explored it as an option with them .
author: Victoria Fritz
BBC transport correspondent

documents.title: top city regulator used tax break scheme
text: the incoming head of the financial industry regulator had to repay tax after using an unapproved tax break scheme .
charles randell , who becomes chair of the financial conduct authority in april , told mps he had made an `` error of judgement '' by putting money into ingenious film partners 2 .
the scheme makes use of tax breaks available to promote film productions .
mr randell paid into the scheme between 2006 and 2011 .
read more here .

documents.title: bus vs taxi
text: ft european technology correspondent aliya ram tweets :
yo citymapper has been granted its private hire license from tfl .
is this a sign of the times ?
my scoop :
pivoting from free wildly-popular app to revenue generating business was never going to be an easy feat
the 8-person , changing route taxi might be an interesting concept given citymapper 's insight into route needs and patterns .

documents.title: venezuela launches cryptocurrency
text: venezuela launches oil cryptocurrency
estupidos venezolanos , shitholes
that 's the solution for sanctions hope iran and rusia go with them and create an oil cryptic .
well , that 'll be a viable long term investment vehicle for venezuela 's money launderers .
wow the oil their selling is still in the ground according to pbs .

documents.title: brexiters 'reckless ' over peace process
text: irish deputy pm criticises uk politicians for questioning the future of the good friday agreement .

documents.title: flying taxis within five years ?
text: uber chief dara khosrowshahi predicts that flying taxis will be commercially viable within five to 10 years .
khosrowshahi was speaking earlier today at an investor forum in tokyo .
uber sees populous japan as a potentially lucrative market and is pressing regulators to ease stringent rules governing the taxi industry .
the company struck a deal with nasa in november as part of its plans to roll out flying cars in cities around the world .

documents.title: fsb : small firms 'lack trust in lenders '
text: the mistreatment of customers at rbs ' global restructuring group and other financial scandals has led to `` a lack of trust in major lenders among small businesses '' says mike cherry of the federation of small businesses .
`` small firms want to see the finance landscape change , with increased competition from challenger banks and non-traditional lenders , '' he says .
mr cherry adds : `` it 's hard to believe that victims of grg were left with nowhere to turn when they had their lives destroyed a decade ago .
but nothing in the fca 's regulatory framework has meaningfully changed since then .
what 's more , its recommendations for giving more firms access to the financial ombudsman are wafer thin . ''

documents.title: carl icahn urges xerox to sell itself to rivals
text: xerox shareholders carl icahn and darwin deason have said that the us company should seek to sell itself to one of its rivals or a private equity firm instead of being taken over by fujifilm .
xerox could combine with a competitor that is willing to pay a significant premium , the shareholders wrote in an open letter .
at the end of january fujifilm said it was set to take over xerox in a $ 6.1bn deal and combine it into an existing joint venture , fuji xerox .
the activist investors had urged shareholders to vote against the deal .

documents.title: rbs grg report 'shines light on gruesome culture '
text: the publication of an fca report into how rbs business unit grg mistreated customers `` shines a light on the gruesome culture within grg '' says laith khalaf , a senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
`` it paints a very sorry of the excesses of the banking industry during the financial crisis and in its aftermath , '' he says .
`` today the banking industry is more sober than it was , and while misconduct still does occur , the most egregious transgressions look to be in the rear view mirror . ''
if only we on the business live page could share his optimism

documents.title: embattled qualcomm ups bid for nxp
text: qualcomm boosts nxp bid as it resists broadcom takeover
flyer # design for business # marketing.you can contact me if you need

documents.title: one 's in fashion
text: her maj has popped along to london fashion week today , as press association reporter catherine wylie tweets :
the queen and anna wintour have a chat on the front row at @ twitterid
the queen and anna wintour have a chat on the front row at @ twitterid london fashion week
the queen and anna wintour have a chat on the front row at @ twitterid
she has her own acrylic chair brought in with cushions and hand rest !
there is only one , and there will never be another # hrh
the queen and anna wintour have a chat on the front row at @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid am surprise she came , respect for the queen

documents.title: what a mad max britain would look like
text: brexit secretary david davis mentioned mad max in a brexit speech and people have run with it .

documents.title: walmart shares plunge after profits disappoint
text: walmart shares are down almost 10 % in trading in new york after the giant retailer 's quarterly profit did n't meet analyst expectations .
its online sales growth for the holiday season - still at 23 % - slowed down as growth fueled by its acquisition of jet.com lessened .

documents.title: dhl apologises for chicken chaos
text: delivery firm dhl says it `` regrets the interruption of supply '' of chicken to kfc , but has said it is `` not the only party responsible for the supply chain '' , which includes its `` partner qsl '' .
`` the reasons for this unforeseen interruption of this complex service are being worked on with a goal to return to normal service levels as soon as possible .
`` with the help of our partner qsl , we are committed to step by step improvements to allow kfc to re-open its stores over the coming days . ''
hundreds of kfc outlets remain closed after chicken distribution problems .

documents.title: starmer : brexit responses 'farcical '
text: david davis has said that britain will not be `` plunged into a mad max-style world borrowed from dystopian fiction '' after it leaves the eu .
the brexit secretary said the uk wo n't be leading a `` competitive race to the bottom '' , instead it will lead a `` global race to the top ''
but in response , labour 's sir keir starmer , the shadow brexit secretary , says :
`` this is getting farcical really .
there 's david davis today saying it wo n't be mad max , we 're not going to deregulate , nothing 's going to be really any different .
last week , by contrast , we had boris johnson , championing deregulation and difference and that 's the whole point of the exercise .
so you 've got two , as ever , two different view within a week of each other . ''

documents.title: rbs : grg report 'difficult reading '
text: rbs has responded to the publication of a report into mistreatment of customers by its global restructuring group :
`` we are deeply sorry that customers did not receive the experience they should have done while in grg , '' a spokesperson says .
`` the report makes for very difficult reading and some of the language used by our staff in the past was clearly unacceptable .

although the most serious allegation - that we deliberately targeted otherwise viable businesses in order to distress and asset-strip them for the bank 's profit - has been shown to be without foundation , we know that the bank got a lot wrong in how it treated some customers in grg during the financial crisis . ''

the fca report found that for more than 10 % of its customers the bank may have caused `` material financial distress '' but that was difficult to say whether this distress caused businesses to fail .

documents.title: breakingmps publish 'disgraceful ' rbs report
text: the treasury select committee has published an fca report into mistreatment of customers by royal bank of scotland 's global restructuring group ( grg ) .
chair nicky morgan says : `` the findings in the report are disgraceful .

the overarching priority at all levels of grg was not the health and strength of customers , but the generation of income for rbs , through made-up fees , high interest rates , and the acquisition of equity and property . ''
a leaked unofficial version had already appeared online .

documents.title: kfc chaos 'not a police matter '
text: no fried chicken ?
police in tower hamlets have asked members of the public not to contact them over kfc restaurants running out of chicken , saying it 's not a police matter .
hundreds of kfcs remain closed after the fast food chain switched from specialist food distribution firm bidvest to dhl .
please do not contact us about the # kfccrisis - it is not a police matter if your favourite eatery is not serving the menu that you desire .
i 'm pretty sure this example is a police matter
i 'd advise @ twitterid to contact @ twitterid to deal .
thanks for bringing it to our attention .
but if it were a @ twitterid crisis we 'd all know about it .
do n't even joke about such a possibility !
i live in massachusetts in the usa .
there 's no krispy kreme in a 100 mile radius .
i live the krispy kreme crisis every day because people here in this state have no taste buds .
you need to move house
i plan on it when i get my life more stable
you want a stable too ? ?
house , stable , doughnuts that 's living !
lol .
but i just want to get a good job somewhere else .
believe .
i suspect fowl play !
that 's enough twitter for one day
excuse me but i 'm rather proud of my witty comment !
i 'm wasted on 'ere
i never said it was n't good , i just said that it was enough twitter for one day , as you have won the pun game !
thanks .
shucks !
i did n't realise @ twitterid was making international calls
if kfc is out , obviously we go to wing wings .
wow !
are people really that stupid ?
yes , they voted for brexit .
as my adorable great nephew carlton might say : true dat

documents.title: wall street opens in the red
text: just in : wall street snaps a six-day winning streak , dow down 0.4 percent , s & p down 0.4 percent , nasdaq down 0.39 percent at market open
might be better to wait until the closing bell to say the winning streak is over .
the day just started folks .

documents.title: gove backing brexit farm workers support
text: the environment secretary says the case for special arrangements for seasonal workers is `` compelling '' .

documents.title: is the local newspaper industry dying ? a former coventry evening telegraph printer looks back
text: is the local newspaper industry dying ? a former coventry evening telegraph printer looks back

documents.title: germany to make it easier to hire and fire bankersthe ft tweets
text: germany woos banks with plan to make it easier to fire executives

documents.title: fox warns brussels on trade tariffs
text: international trade secretary liam fox has warned eu leaders that imposing new tariff barriers with the uk after brexit will make their own economies less competitive .
talking to the eef manufacturers ' organisation in london , fox said that any attempt by the remaining 27 member states to create new barriers to trade would rebound against them .
`` this government opposes erecting barriers to trade where none yet exists , or disrupting the commercial relationships that exist between this country and our continental partners , '' he said .
`` if europe erects barriers to trade and investment that do not exist today , it will make europe less competitive in a global context and less attractive to international investors . ''

documents.title: despite losses . melrose positive on gkn bid
text: turnaround specialist melrose has reported another annual loss but says takeover target gkn would `` gain significantly '' by accepting its £ 7.4bn bid and joining the business .
melrose reported a statutory loss of £ 27.6m for the year to 31 december , compared to a £ 69.3m loss the previous year .

the company said it took on `` significant '' restructuring costs at manufacturer nortek which it bought in 2016 , and was forced to contend with the `` structural decline of the core gas turbine market '' which affected its brush business - a maker of electricity generation equipment .
but melrose chairman christopher miller said the firm remains positive on the takeover of gkn .
`` we are convinced that gkn would gain significantly from becoming part of an enlarged £ 10bn uk industrial powerhouse , '' he said .

documents.title: asda turnaround 'happening slowly '
text: bryan roberts , global insights director at tcc global , says asda 's fourth quarter results are encouraging , but it still has more to do .
`` we 've seen a marked improvement in service levels and sharper all-round availability .
the grocer played a good game over christmas too , with aspirational adverts that did n't just focus on price proving popular , '' he said .
however , he felt that asda is a far cry from what it used to be - a `` fun '' place to be with `` layouts designed to delight young children in particular '' .
`` it 's lost some of that spirit over the years , but its recent seasonal campaigns - such as at christmas and halloween - show it still has that capability in the locker .
yes , this is a heartening turnaround - but it 's happening slowly , '' he said .
`` a focus on re-capturing a year-round family appeal could catalyse its ongoing recovery . ''

documents.title: peer to pier funding needed
text: hastings pier is up for sale .
the grade ii listed victorian pier has been rebuilt in recent years after being virtually destroyed by fire in 2010 .
the new-look 280m long pier was reopened to the public in 2016 and awarded the riba stirling prize for architecture in 2017 .
but the hastings pier charity went into administration last november after failing to complete a fundraising exercise for the pier to reach self-funding status within three years .
now the administrators are looking for a buyer for the pier 's freehold .

documents.title: asda sales climb 0.5 %
text: asda has reported a 0.5 % rise in like-for-like sales .
however the fourth quarter increase marks a slowdown from the 1.1 % rise reported in the third quarter .
doug mcmillon , chief executive of asda 's owner walmart , said : `` in the uk , asda delivered positive comp sales again this quarter with particular strength during the christmas period . ''
he added : `` we know we have more work to do in the uk , however we are encouraged by recent results in key areas of our business . ''

documents.title: murdoch doubles length of independent sky news offer
text: rupert murdoch 's twenty-first century fox has today upped its offer to maintain and fund a fully independent sky-branded news service from five years to 10 .
the company is trying to overcome regulatory concerns about fox 's takeover of the parent company .

the competitition and markets authority has said fox 's $ 15.7bn ( £ 11.22bn ) deal to buy the 61 % of sky it does not already own should be blocked unless a way is found to reduce the influence murdoch could wield through the ownership of sky news .

documents.title: mps could make controversial rbs/grg report public
text: a group of mps could release a controversial report into the royal bank of scotland 's mistreatment of small businesses this afternoon .

the treasury select committee is meeting in private today to discuss whether to officially publish the widely-leaked report into global restructuring group , the banking giant 's much-criticised restructuring arm .
the behind-closed-doors meeting could thrash out timings , with mps deciding whether to immediately release the document using parliamentary privilege or hold fire .

documents.title: brexit uk 'wo n't be mad max-style world '
text: britain will not be `` plunged into a mad max-style world borrowed from dystopian fiction '' after it leaves the eu , the brexit secretary said this morning .

in a speech to austrian business leaders in vienna , david davis said the uk wanted to lead a `` global race to the top '' in rights and standards not , as some feared , a `` competitive race to the bottom '' .
british business could `` never be cheaper than china '' and must focus instead on product and service quality .
he also suggested a brexit deal by the end of 2018 was `` well on the cards '' .

documents.title: two-bentley mullins ? bbc correspondent simon gompertz snapped pimlico plumbers boss 's motors at the supreme court
text: pimlico plumbers ' charlie mullins arrived at the supreme court in his convoy of two blue bentleys
he 's obviously feeling flush
is the other one for the chip on his shoulder or his ego
not surprised , with their outrageous prices .
obviously needed a 2nd opinion on what was causing the air blockage
@ twitterid what else would you expect from someone who supports this awful government !
he 's selling his business ?
had to take the plunge at some point
hedge fund manager , barrister regrets not becoming a plumber .
you just ca n't get the staff these days

documents.title: william hill shares making ground
text: despite that large £ 6.2m penalty package from the gambling commission for lax money laundering controls , shares in william hill are ahead in late morning trading .
shares in the bookmaker are up 0.68 % at 326.10p .

documents.title: pound climbs against euro on brexit boost
text: the pound climbed 0.4 % against the euro this morning after a report from the european parliament called for the uk to have at least some access to the single market .
there could be more good news tomorrow , said hamish muress , currency analyst at ofx .

`` we could see the pound benefit further if wage growth figures show a narrowing of the deficit with inflation , and mark carney will surely walk into the parliamentary treasury committee hearing with a little more confidence , knowing that his law-making counterparts are slowly ironing out the brexit details , '' said mr muress .
`` today 's report goes to show how when brexit news comes back to the fore , it can be the key driver that dominates market sentiment . ''

documents.title: seafood firm sees 20,000 salmon escape
text: someone could be in for the high jump at grieg seafood .
the firm has admitted a major escape from one of its cages anchored in loch snizort , near the isle of skye .
it said it believed about 21,700 fish escaped , with an average weight of 2kg .
the damage was discovered by a diver during a routine check at the fish farm on 11 february .
a report has been submitted to the government agency marine scotland .

documents.title: hotel boss : 'it 's been a wonderful year '
text: keith barr , the chief executive of intercontinental hotels , is feeling very cheery today , after the hotelier posted a 7 % rise in operating profits in 2017 .
`` it 's been a wonderful , wonderful year for ihg with really strong results , '' he told bbc business live .
`` with the strengthening of the us dollar , it 's made the uk an even more attractive destination - i think you 'll see more and more holiday travellers here . ''
mr barr said that growth in chinese travellers was `` simply extraordinary '' , and that travel tended to continue to grow , even after issues like the financial crisis or terrorism .
`` having more hotels here will be great on the long term for the health of the uk economy , '' he said .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: so where is the chicken ?
text: supply chain expert steve jones tells bbc breakfast how a decision to switch delivery company led to hundreds of stores closing on monday .
`` so where is the chicken ! ? ''
@ seanfarrington chats to a food supply chain expert about kfc 's decision to switch delivery company .
it 's resulted in 100s of store closures because the chicken has n't been delivered .
# kfccrisis
can anyone tell me why this is headline news ?
probably sent abroad with our aid money .
made me smile `` what is the driving force behind this decision ? ''
clearly the driving force are all parked up in lay-bys !
red faces at dhl then with starving clients around the country !
i wont be using them for deliveries .
i really thought that kfc was that quorn stuff , just shows you cant always believe whats on your plate .
are dhl delivering the chicken because russell hume ca n't ?
and kfc did n't want to be caught up in that ?
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: dunelm shares slump
text: furnishings retailer dunelm 's shares have fallen 9.7 % or 63 points to 583.5p , on the news that underlying profit fell due to lower margins and higher operating costs .

`` consumer spending is softer of course , but the decline in property market activity is key - the less people move home the less they spend on new furnishings , '' said neil wilson , senior market analyst for etx capital .
`` margins are the real worry .
not only is the worldstores acquisition dragging down the group average , but it was also due to a higher proportion of end of season and seasonal products .
`` the concern is that dunelm is heavily discounting to maintain market share , generating good headline like-for-like sales growth at the expense of profit . ''

documents.title: charlie mullins arrives at supreme court
text: personal finance correspondent simon gompertz is at the supreme court , where pimlico plumbers boss charlie mullins has just arrived
charlie mullins , pimlico plumbers , at supreme court to appeal against ruling that his self employed '' plumber had workers rights
he 's advocating going back to victorian working practices for employees leave him alone and give him a knighthood not
headline presented like mullins is the bad guy .
a little bit more to it .
to appeal against `` workers ' rights '' ?
what a sad , bad , cruel man .
in short , a tory .
ty tory to hell with employees rights while pocketing all the profits
kids , botox is clearly very bad for you .

documents.title: william hill fine `` could go up '' says gambling commission
text: the bookmakers william hill has been fined £ 6.2 million by the gambling commission .
the fine has been labelled as a failure by senior management to protect consumers and prevent money laundering .

tim miller of the gambling commission told bbc breakfast that 2.5 million people in the uk are either problem gamblers or at risk of becoming one - and that the gambling industry should take their responsibilities to these people seriously .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: plumbers must wait to find out their rights
text: eagerly awaiting the outcome of the pimlico pumbler workers ' rights case ?
you 'll need to be patient !
the case involving former pimlico plumber worker gary smith hits the supreme court this morning at 10.30am .
it hinges on whether he is entitled to basic workers ' rights , although he is technically self-employed .
lower courts have backed mr smith but what will the supreme court rule ?
sadly we wo n't find out for three to six months , we hear , as the judges consider the legal arguments presented from both sides over the next two days .

documents.title: market movers
text: while the ftse 100 remains flat , down just 0.11 % , the big firms publishing figures today have all seen their share prices fall .
intercontinental hotel group leads the losers , down 4.47 % , while hsbc has fallen 4.33 % .
finally there 's miner bhp billiton , down 3.03 % .
on the other side evraz is having another positive day , climbing 3.96 % .

documents.title: would you grass up long-lunching colleagues ?
text: do you silently seeth at colleagues who take long lunches ?
who sit around the office reading the paper ?
or perhaps pop off for endless cigarette breaks ?
well maybe you should go work at the australian tax office - which is encouraging staff to , `` dob in '' colleagues who break the rules .
`` you might have seen it before .

a colleague makes a habit of taking long lunches , or regularly leaves early , or spends the first hour at work eating breakfast and reading the paper or all of the above , '' read the memo , now published on the agency 's website .
but unions and workplace experts are not impressed .
they say the policy is intruding on privacy and turning employees against each other .
what do you think the reaction would be in your workplace ?
send us your comments to bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: will barclays report a profit ?
text: finance blogger frances coppola is not so sure that barclays will have anything positive to say when it releases its full-year results on thursday .
`` barclays has got problems in its investment division which is not doing anything like as well as it had been hoping , '' she told today .

`` i 'm not convinced because they 've got this huge rock ahead - known as the mortgage mis-selling suit in america , and rumours are that it 's going to be vast , so if it does report a profit and they have n't put in anymore provisions against that , then it will be a very risky profit indeed . ''

on top of barclays ' woes in the us , earlier this month the uk 's serious fraud office charged the bank with `` unlawful financial assistance '' related to a £ 12bn loan which it took from qatar in 2008 in order to avoid a government bailout during the financial crisis .
and if that is n't enough , barclays is also awaiting a decision from the financial conduct authority over chief executive jes staley .
staley had attempted to identify a whistleblower who was concerned about a senior job being given to a friend of the chief executive .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: india bank fraud : nirav modi speaks out
text: the billionaire jeweller accused of involvement in india 's biggest ever bank fraud has commented for the first time .
nirav modi wrote to punjab national bank , saying it had shown `` overzealousness '' in going public with the amount of money he owed .
the letter , which has been leaked , said the allegations had essentially destroyed his diamond trading business - making the prospect of him repaying debts impossible .
mr modi and others are accused of colluding with employees at the bank .
it 's alleged they obtained fraudulent advances for payments to overseas suppliers worth about $ 1.8bn ( £ 1.3bn ) from the indian government-run lender .

his lawyer has said nothing untoward went on , saying all mr modi 's dealings with pnb were documented and adding that the state-owned bank had regularly levied fees on its dealings with the jeweller 's firms .

documents.title: dunelm sales climb 6 %
text: like-for-like sales at furnishings retailer dunelm climbed 6 % in the first half .
but underlying profit fell 8 % year-on-year for the 26 weeks to the end of december .

new chief executive nick wilkinson took over from 1 february and chairman andy harrison said his `` leadership skills and retail pedigree will help us to deliver our ambitious growth plans to build dunelm as the leading multi-channel retailer in our space . ''
meanwhile the company announced that chief financial officer keith down will step down in june .
the interim dividend was increased to 7p per share .

documents.title: venezuela launches its own crypto-currency
text: venezuela has launched its very own crypto-currency today - the petro will go on sale today , and president nicolas maduro hopes the digital currency will help the country make financial transactions and get around western economic sanctions .

`` the difference with this crypto-currency is that the government says it is backed by one barrel of oil , so it 's a way for the venezuelan government to say that this currency has some extra real-world value , '' bbc 's south america reporter daniel gallas told today .
`` the problem is that venezuela 's oil has n't been enough to create value for this huge country , which has been at the heart of the crisis the country is going through . ''
he said it is not clear whether it would be breaking the rules for banks and investors to use petro to conduct business with the country .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asian stock markets mixed
text: asian markets were mixed today .
msci 's broadest index of asia-pacific shares outside japan fell 0.25 % .
south korea 's kospi lost 1.2 % but hong kong 's hang seng edged up 0.1 % .
but japan 's nikkei index retreated 0.9 % after three successive days of gains .

documents.title: intercontinental profits climb 7 % as it launches new brand
text: holiday inn owner intercontinental hotels group has posted a 7 % hike in operating profits to $ 759m ( £ 544m ) for 2017 .
it said revenue for the year at the company - which has 5,300 hotels - grew 4 % to $ 1.78bn ( £ 1.28bn ) .
the annual dividend climbed 11 % to 104 cents per share .

looking ahead , keith barr , chief executive of ihg said , `` we remain positive in the outlook for the year ahead and we are confident that our ambitious plans will deliver a meaningful change in ihg 's growth . ''

it is launching a new mainstream brand called avid hotels and mr barr reported that `` since september we have signed 75 hotels , with the first due to open later this year and a global launch being planned . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 opens positively
text: the ftse 100 began the day 's trading at 7,250 up 0.1 % , suggesting it could be another quiet day .
yesterday it fell 0.64 % or 47.04 points .

documents.title: kfc : the worrying signs were already there
text: what 's gone wrong at kfc ?
the worrying signs were there , reckons procurement expert steve jones , managing director at focal point .
he told wake up to money : `` kfc introduced too many changes all at the same time while it looks like dhl has taken on too much business .

`` last october they did a deal with carlsberg which was referred to the cma [ competition and markets authority ] and immediately they took over the distribution they started having loads of union problems .

`` that was about the same time kfc decided to move from bidvest to dhl and , if i 'd have been working at kfc at that time , i 'd have had a good look around to make sure that all the 't 's were crossed and the 'i 's were dotted ! ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
Wake Up To Money

documents.title: william hill 'not properly staffed '
text: tim miller , executive director of the gambling commission , has told the today programme that there were many clear warning signs that william hill should have up on .
`` in many respects , this was n't properly resourced or staffed , so a lot of the checks were n't happening .
people were potentially able to gamble money that was the proceeds of crime - in one case , money stolen from a local council , '' he said .
he said there were many examples of customers who showed signs of problem gambling that were not getting the support and attention that they should be getting .
`` there were clear warning signs , the escalating amount of money that was being spent should have set off alarm bells , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: gloom and doom ahead for markets
text: gervais williams , senior executive director at fund house milton group , is definitely not feeling optimistic about the markets in 2018 .

`` we 've had a long period where there have been quite a lot of cash surpluses in markets , but we 're entering a period of quantitative tightening and we 're seeing buybacks are less frequent , dividend growth is getting a little tighter , '' he told today .
`` going forward liquidity might become a little tighter . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: william hill ceo responds
text: william hill chief philip bowcock has made a statement about the £ 6.2m fine .
he said : `` we are fully committed to operating a sustainable business that properly identifies risk and better protects customers .
we will continue to assist the commission and work with other operators to improve practices in the areas identified . ''
but some of the details released by the gambling commission are quite shocking .
one customer was allowed to deposit £ 654,000 over nine months without source of funds checks being carried out .
the customer lived in rented accommodation and earned around £ 30,000 a year .

another customer was allowed to deposit £ 541,000 over 14 months after william hill made the assumption that the customer 's potential income could be £ 365,000 a year based on a verbal conversation and without further probing .
in fact the customer was earning just£ 30,000 a year and was funding his gambling habit by stealing from his employer .

documents.title: william hill 'failed to protect customers '
text: bookies william hill has been ordered to pay £ 6.2m in penalties for failing to protect customers and prevent money laundering .
ten customers were able to deposit large sums of money linked to criminal offences which resulted in gains for the betting business of around £ 1.2m .
the gambling commission said william hill did not adequately seek information about the source of their funds or establish whether they were problem gamblers .
the gambling firm will pay more than £ 5m for breaching regulations and divest themselves of the £ 1.2m they earned from the 10 customers .
victims will be reimbursed and external auditors will be appointed to oversee the implementation of anti-money laundering and social responsibility policies .

neil mcarthur , executive director at the commission said : `` gambling businesses have a responsibility to ensure that they keep crime out of gambling and tackle problem gambling - and as part of that they must be constantly curious about where the money they are taking is coming from . ''

documents.title: breakingwilliam hill fined £ 6.2m
text: william hill to pay £ 6.2m penalty package for systemic social responsibility and money laundering failures .
a gambling commission investigation revealed that between november 2014 and august 2016 the gambling business breached anti-money laundering and social responsibility regulations .

documents.title: hsbc 'on its way to recovery '
text: hsbc 's latest results are definitely a vast improvement on previous years , says hugh young , head of the asia business at aberdeen standard .
`` not quite as good as expected in terms of pure numbers , but i think the message is clear - the bank is well on its way to recovery , '' he told today .

`` every financial institution is under incredible scrutiny today , especially visible institutions like hsbc , and hsbc did make some near-fatal mistakes - in mexico , with home savings -that would have killed any minor institution . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: best half-year profits since 2014 for bhp
text: underlying half-year profits at the world 's biggest miner bhp billiton have climbed 25 % .
the figures posted by the anglo-australian miner were boosted by robust commodity prices with copper and oil the main drivers of the increase in profits .
underlying profit for the half year ended 31 december climbed to $ 4.05bn ( £ 2.09bn ) from $ 3.24bn ( £ 2.32bn ) a year ago .
however , that was less than expected by analysts .
the miner declared an interim dividend of 55 cents a share , up from 40 cents a share last year .

documents.title: good times in prospect for banks
text: after hsbc 's bumper profits , gervais williams , senior executive director at miton asset management , predicts good news from the rest of the banking sector .
`` banks have come through quite a bad period , '' he tells wake up to money .
`` they 've had a lot of write-downs from the global financial crisis , which has come to an end .
`` there have been a lot of regulatory problems which has led to quite a lot of write-offs and fines , and they 've had a certain amount of restructuring , including hsbc .

but they 're not at the end of that period so they can now hopefully run their businesses lending to fund good growth going forward but also with very strong financial ratios so that they can withstand any setbacks , if there are any coming up . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
Wake Up To Money

documents.title: oil prices split
text: oil markets were split on tuesday , with us crude pushed up by reduced flows from canada while international brent prices eased .
u.s. west texas intermediate crude futures were at $ 62.38 a barrel , up 70 cents , or 1.1 % , from their last settlement .

outside north america , brent crude eased on the back of a dip in asian stocks and a stronger dollar , which potentially curbs demand as it makes fuel more expensive for countries using other currencies domestically .
brent crude futures were at $ 65.48 per barrel , down 19 cents , or 0.3 % , from their last close .

documents.title: hsbc profits more than double to $ 17.2bn
text: more signs that hsbc 's recovery drive is working , with news that it made a pre-tax profit of $ 17.2bn ( £ 12.3bn ) in 2017 .
that 's a 141 % jump on the $ 7.1bn profit of the previous year .
but before we get too carried away , bear in mind 2016 was a particularly tough year , with some hefty one-off costs , meaning the comparison is a tad flattering .
while hsbc is listed on the london stock exchange and remains a staple of the uk high street , drilling into the figures shows just how much this is now a bank driven by asia .
the lion 's share of those pre-tax profits ( $ 15.3bn of them ) came from the region , while europe clocked up a $ 1.9bn loss .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live today where we 'll keep you up to date with all the breaking stories throughout the day until 9.30pm .
we 've already seen figures from hsbc this morning but we 'll also have final results from intercontinental .
there 's be interim figures for bhp billiton and dunelm .
the pimlico plumbers employment case kicks off in the supreme court at 10.30am .
meanwhile parliament remains in recess .
